CSettings Class Reference

#include <MSettingsStorage.h>

Detailed Description

Settings base class.

To add useness, you have to derive from this base class and add some member variables and a MAP to relate these members to the Load/Save behaviour.

Each map item macro has three forms. As an example, here are the macros for simple types: SETTING_ITEM()
SETTING_ITEM_DEFAULT()
SETTING_ITEM_REQUIRE()

Definition at line 75 of file MSettingsStorage.h.

Overrideables

These are called before and after the load or save operations inside Load() and Save().

You get a chance here to be notified of the load and save operations.
StorageOk indicates if opening or closing the storage was successful. If it wasn't the real load or save operations are not executed.

virtual void OnBeforeSave (bool StorageOk)
virtual void OnAfterSave (bool StorageOk)
virtual void OnBeforeLoad (bool StorageOk)
virtual void OnAfterLoad (bool StorageOk)

Public Member Functions

virtual bool Load (CSettingsStorage &Storage)
 Load the settings from Storage.

virtual bool Save (CSettingsStorage &Storage)
 Save the settings to Storage.

Member Function Documentation

bool CSettings::Load (  CSettingsStorage &  Storage  )  [inline, virtual]
 

Load the settings from Storage.

Note that it's up to the caller to init the Storage and to move to the right position.

Parameters:
Storage Any initialized storage object. (Can be different from the one passed in Save()).
Returns:
Success status.
